com.sails.map

Interface Projection


  • public interface Projection
    A Projection translates between the pixel coordinate system on the screen and geographical points on the earth. To retrieve the currently used Projection for a given MapView, call the MapView.getProjection() method.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GeoPoint fromPixels(int x, int y)
      Translates the given screen coordinates to a GeoPoint.
      double getLatitudeSpan() 
      double getLongitudeSpan() 
      float metersToPixels(float meters, byte zoomLevel)
      Converts the given distance in meters at the given zoom level to the corresponding number of horizontal pixels.
      Point toPixels(GeoPoint in, Point out)
      Translates the given GeoPoint to relative pixel coordinates on the screen.
      Point toPoint(GeoPoint in, Point out, byte zoomLevel)
      Translates the given GeoPoint to absolute pixel coordinates on the world map.

    • Method Detail

      • fromPixels

        GeoPoint fromPixels(int x,
                  int y)
        Translates the given screen coordinates to a GeoPoint. If the corresponding MapView has no valid dimensions (width and height > 0), null is returned.
        Parameters:
        x - the pixel x coordinate on the screen.
        y - the pixel y coordinate on the screen.
        Returns:
        a new GeoPoint or null, if the corresponding MapView has no valid dimensions.

      • getLatitudeSpan

        double getLatitudeSpan()
        Returns:
        the latitude span from the top to the bottom of the map in degrees.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the MapView dimensions are not valid (width and height > 0).

      • getLongitudeSpan

        double getLongitudeSpan()
        Returns:
        the longitude span from the left to the right of the map in degrees.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the MapView dimensions are not valid (width and height > 0).

      • metersToPixels

        float metersToPixels(float meters,
                   byte zoomLevel)
        Converts the given distance in meters at the given zoom level to the corresponding number of horizontal pixels. The calculation is carried out at the current latitude coordinate.
        Parameters:
        meters - the distance in meters.
        zoomLevel - the zoom level at which the distance should be calculated.
        Returns:
        the number of pixels at the current map position and the given zoom level.

      • toPixels

        Point toPixels(GeoPoint in,
             Point out)
        Translates the given GeoPoint to relative pixel coordinates on the screen. If the corresponding MapView has no valid dimensions (width and height > 0), null is returned.
        Parameters:
        in - the geographical point to convert.
        out - an already existing object to use for the output. If this parameter is null, a new Point object will be created and returned.
        Returns:
        a Point which is relative to the top-left of the MapView or null, if the corresponding MapView has no valid dimensions.

      • toPoint

        Point toPoint(GeoPoint in,
            Point out,
            byte zoomLevel)
        Translates the given GeoPoint to absolute pixel coordinates on the world map.
        Parameters:
        in - the geographical point to convert.
        out - an already existing object to use for the output. If this parameter is null, a new Point object will be created and returned.
        zoomLevel - the zoom level at which the point should be converted.
        Returns:
        a Point which is relative to the top-left of the world map.
